ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Furthered my understanding and usage of the Polish language.
I learned relevant phrases and speaking forms to talk in polish
Learned how to speak polish
Built an even better understanding of my polish knowledge.
Gained a greater understanding of the Polish language (speaking, writing, and reading) and culture in Poland.
I learned low level polish that Ive been able to use in real life
We covered more basic Polish grammar topics relating to time. We also had more conversation practice and writing longer prompts.
I further developed my understanding of the Polish language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think it is well taught but could be faster.
Very strong course. Learned a lot. Could hold a conversation in polish
Strengths are the passion from the teacher and students.
Strengths of the course is the meeting periods and the commitment level of the teacher. Professor is dedicated to help students learn/grow as a student and person!
The timing of the course conflicts with other classes for my major, but I know the professor has other classes before and the time cannot be changed
A strength is that Prof. Illakowicz is very accommodating and easy to contact.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I absolutely recommend this course to anyone who needs a language credit.
Yes. Great course learned a lot
I would recommend this course to another student
Absolutely! Professor genuinely cares about students as people and supports them in all aspects such as athletics, academics, artistic areas, and more!
I would recommend this course if you want to learn more practical polish phrases and language.
Yes, I would recommend it to anyone who is interested in learning another language at a manageable pace.
